definition: A force or pressure exerted on an object or surface, often resulting in compression or deformation. It is commonly used to describe the physical sensation or perception of pressure, as well as the act of printing or reproducing text or images onto a surface using a mechanical or digital process.

examples.english: The pressure on me is increasing.

examples.german: Ich habe Druck in den Ohren.
examples.english: I have pressure in my ears.

examples.german: Der Druck auf dem Reifen ist zu niedrig.
examples.english: The pressure on the tire is too low.

examples.german: Sie übt Druck auf ihn aus, damit er nachgibt.
examples.english: She puts pressure on him to make him give in.

examples.german: Der Druck der Wassermassen war enorm.
examples.english: The pressure of the water masses was enormous.
